snippet: Ban Ki-moon said that reforms are not important while people are being killed.
abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon issues statement that Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad should not delude himself that he can remain in power by means of superficial political reforms and referendums, adding that Assad must dismantle the one party-state and engage the opposition; comments come as UN officials attempt to gain Russian and Chinese support for an Arab League plan to end violence in Syria.
lead_paragraph: Ban Ki-moon said that reforms are not important while people are being killed.
